content.raw: @{557058:490c665b-b69c-40f3-80ea-64f20747efc4} My understanding is, that the standard way should be to develop the solution in catkin, then build the docker solution image\(s\) and submit the image\(s\). We used docker containers to develop our solution, only because we did not want to disturb our Gazebo environment as long as the ignition environment was not stable. Additionally it would be a little bit easier to use catkin instead of docker for development.
